subSubSection.paragraph:
Locus typicus: Papua New Guinea , Bismarck Archipelago , Neu Lauenburg [= Duke of York Islands,
4 ° 10 ’S
152 ° 27 ’E
].

Primary type :
Lectotype ( ZMB Moll
101921
) designated by
Kilias ( 1995 : 155 )
.

Type (s) without name-bearing function:
One paralectotype ( ZMH , Godeffroy collection [ 6878 ]).

Material examined:
UF 296065
:
1 adult
spm., Viti Levu, Laucala Bay, behind USP Maritime Studies buildings
18 °09’03’’S
178 ° 27 ’ 14 ’’E
, 0–1 m , sand and mud reef flat, under dead coral rubble and
Halimeda
sp., leg. Lisa Kirkendale & Victor Bonito, 0
6 October 2001
(LAK-005), wet.
Habitat: Our own observation in the Samoan Islands confirm the herein reported habitat. The species shows a preference for solid substratum, which is partly burried in sediment.
Remarks: This is the first record of this species from Fiji .

The status of the name-bearing type of this species was unclear for a long time. According to Thiele’s original description ( 1909 a: 14 ) it seemed that he had only studied a single specimen: “Die Länge des Tieres beträgt 17 mm , die Breite 8 mm ” [the length of the animal is 17 mm , the width 8 mm ].
Kaas & Van
Belle ( 1985
: 165 ) correctly recognised that there must be at least two specimens involved. They designated one as “ paratype ” ( ZMHU [= ZMB ]
101921
), which is dry, lacking the head valve, and measures
16 x 8
mm, and a second disarticulated one, which they regarded the holotype without further comments. Unfortunately, they wrote that the “ holotype ” is also in the ZMB , which is wrong.
Kilias ( 1995 : 155 )
listed the single specimen ZMB Moll
101921
as holotype , unaware that the ZMH also holds a specimen. The latter is partly disarticulated, had its radula removed, is from the Godeffroy collection ( 6878 ), and has a label in Thiele’s handwriting (but without the asterisk he normally used to indicate types ). This seems to be the specimen Thiele used for his description. Unfortunately Kilias’ interpretation of which specimen was the holotype fully meets the requirements of Art. 74.6 of the ICZN , and thus the specimen ZMB Moll
101921
became the lectotype of
Lepidopleurus acuminatus
. Therefore, the above-mentioned specimen from the ZMH is here regarded the paralectotype .
